Data helps drive everything we do – from creating chemical compounds to keeping employees safe. During Harvey, our employee tracking system gathered critical data that allowed our team to account for the safety of those affected by the hurricane.

I’m very excited to start my new role as director of the Los Angeles County Department of Children and Family Services effective December 1. Many thanks to Governor Deal and my staff at Georgia DFCS for the opportunity to serve the children and families of Georgia for the last nearly four years.

(Previously Chief Growth & Strategy Officer)Lead the strategic growth & impact of a national nonprofit with a footprint across 36 states and the District of Columbia.  Grew year-over-year by 800% while building a new externally facing business unit and planning for long term, sustainable revenue growth.    				Business Development/Strategic Partnerships:•	Raised over $90 million in new multi-year commitments from a diverse coalition of funders representing state and federal agencies, foundations, corporations, and high net worth individuals. •	Created a pipeline of invited proposals from private foundations to ensure continued revenue growth, including re-engaging one-time NMSI donors.•	Seeded the launch of three new regions with significant local investment including corporate support ($2mm), school district matching funds (1:8), and a legislative appropriation ($1.2mm).•	Leveraged public partnerships to create earned media and philanthropic opportunities for NMSI, including a $25 million grant from the Department of Defense. •	Managed brand, aligning all marketing collateral, external messaging, and internal communications resulting in a 30% increase in earned media (year-to-date).Organizational Development and Leadership:•	Lead business and strategic planning for the deployment of nearly $100mm in new investment.•	Launched a performance management and compensation system, the organization’s first, to ensure employees are appropriately coached, developed, evaluated, and compensated.•	Lead and manage a five-person executive team to drive measurable results within their business units.•	Evaluated NMSI’s programs for effectiveness and efficiency resulting in external review, validation, and recommendations for improvements to drive greater impact.•	Significantly increased board communication and created authentic engagement opportunities.

The Children and Family Fellowship is an intensive executive leadership program, now in its third decade, designed to give child and family-serving professionals the confidence and competence to lead major system reforms and community change initiatives that get results. Without strong leadership, investments in programs and system reform initiatives alone are not enough to create urgent, long-lasting improvements for children and families.

Launched non-profit organization with $1M lead gift from local philanthropist that spurred an additional $44 million in investment from local, regional, and national funders.  Seeded a high quality charter school movement in San Antonio that now serves over 18,000 students throughout the city.

Spearheaded awareness for award-winning charter school management organization, IDEA Public Schools is a CMO serving over 15,000 students across a network of 34 schools.Business Development/Strategic Partnerships:•	Raised $12.5 million by pursuing new markets.•	Lead a team of staff and consultants on the Race to the Top District competition, resulting in over $32 million to support IDEA’s individualized learning strategy.  .•	Acquired high performing private school as first San Antonio open-enrollment charter schools totaling $15 million in facilities & land as a partial philanthropic gift & real estate agreement.New Market Launch:•	Launched 16 new schools in three regions, including schools in new markets.•	Lead organization’s 2017 business planning process to outline new market growth, flesh out organizational gaps/needs along with scalable solutions, and financial modeling for growth.Advocacy/Government Relations:•	Led all government relations functions including local building and zoning issues, statewide policy affecting public education, and federal relations on education policy issues. •	Provided invited testimony before Senate Education Committee and House Ways and Means Committee regarding access to the Permanent School Fund, which subsequently passed.Organizational Development and Leadership:•	Led six staff members to outstanding results in fundraising, program, and communications.•	Senior cabinet member supporting strategic initiatives around human capital & personalized learning.•	Manage the reporting and compliance of a $60M million grant portfolio •	Raised $40M through grants from the Texas Education Agency, and U.S. Department of Education.•	Raised $20M+ in expansion and program funding from The Michael and Susan Dell Foundation, The Gates Foundation, the Walton Foundation, The Texas High School Project, and other private funders.

Led non-partisan foundation that offers co-curricular programs preparing students for lifelong, engaged citizenship.  Active in 500+ high schools in 34 states, the foundation has a $6 million annual operating budget. Organizational Development & Leadership•	Led team of 10 high-performing professionals in Washington, DC, and California.•	Developed programs to sustain Foundation revenue sources, including the organization’s first international program, in China.•	Established annual organizational goals, linking them to staff objectives, maximizing outcomes. External Relations & Business Development•	Created multi-year fundraising and resource development plan, increasing annual contributions from $650,000 to $1.92 million over a three-year period.  •	Led the organization’s government relations; grew federal and state funding by 40%.•	Created new program partnerships to grow the organization’s footprint, impact, and revenue.•	Increased general and scholarship support by $325,000 (47%).Program Management & Operations•	Partnered with Georgetown, Stanford, and Princeton to create high-school civic education academies.•	Hire, train, and evaluate 75 summer staff members including college/university faculty members.
